question: The traditional ‘Lantern Festival’, which was making news recently, is celebrated in which country?
explanation:
China celebrates its traditional Lantern festival, on the 15th day of the first Chinese lunar month.
The festival also marks the final day of the Chinese New Year or ‘Spring Festival’ period. This year, the country entered the ‘Year of the Ox’ on February 12, 2021. This Festival also falls the first full moon night in the Chinese calendar.
